interestingcomments.content: Just to open up another reason for using a hand held light meter; in my case a Pentax spot meter. I have found that I can better judge when I've reached the limits of the camera sensor's capability (without additional lighting) by measuring the EV value of a subjects recognizable shadow area. In the case of the Digilux 6 if I keep the recognizable shadow area above EV5 I won't get yellow blotches in an expanse of low light area. In the case of the X-Vario, keeping the recognizable shadow area above EV4 will prevent noise /color issues in the shadows. Essentially, it lets me know when low light conditions are going to cause problems for the digital camera sensor across the recorded light range of the sensor for a particular scene.
